candidates.title: Require version ^0.3.7 of the futures crates and upgrade nom to version 6
Cargo hack
candidates.body: Refactor CI configuration, added cargo hack to test all combination of features and fixed all errors and warnings caught by it

candidates.title: Add deps.rs badge
candidates.body: [deps.rs](https://deps.rs) has recently been resurrected, and we depend on many dependencies, so we probably want to keep track of the dependency status

candidates.title: chore(all): Prepare 0.10.0-alpha.3 release
candidates.body: Could be a good time for another alpha release.

candidates.title: Tokio 0.3 support
candidates.body:
Depends on the following crates being released:

* [x] `tokio-native-tls`
* [x] `tokio-rustls`

Yes, there is a lot of duplication with supporting both tokio 0.2 and tokio0.3, and even more if we end-up supporting async-std in the future. I have a few ideas for a future PR to improve the situation.

candidates.title: Add doc_cfg attributes
candidates.body:
This pull request adds doc_cfg attributes mentioned in #451 
I started with annotating only the public-facing items. Would you prefer doc_cfg on all private items as well?

Please let me know if there's anything else I've missed or you would like improved. 😃

candidates.title: bump base64 version to 0.13.0
candidates.body: This is part of #467 with the [matching bump on hyperx](https://github.com/dekellum/hyperx/pull/23)

candidates.title: Bump openssl major version: 0.9 -> 0.10 for the old lettre v0.6
candidates.body:
This is an update to the old lettre v0.6 which my ancient codebase is still using at the moment. v0.6 depends on the version 0.9 of the openssl crate, which doesn't support the newer OpenSSL versions. I don't know whether this old version of lettre is maintained in any sense anymore, but accepting this would make my life easier.

# Details
* Bump openssl minor version: 0.9 -> 0.10 to allow upgrading OpenSSL.
  * Tested lettre with openssl 0.10 to build without problems with my own code.
* Leave the range to continue including 0.9, so crates depending on lettre 0.6 are able to stay at openssl 0.9 if they so choose.
  * Because the minimum version of openssl was not restricted, this should be a backwards compatible change.
* Bump lettre patch version to 0.6.3.
* A `cargo publish` after merging this would be very nice!

candidates.title: Allow configuring a custom root certificate in TlsParametersBuilder
candidates.body: Fixes #472 and should probably remove the last remaining concern with not being able to use a preconfigured TLS client anymore since #448

candidates.title: More improvements
candidates.body:
A few more random improvements I made by looking around in the code.

Regarding the second-last commit, I'm not sure what the best way of tidying up dependencies is in Cargo.toml, any suggestions are welcome. I just felt like not having a big list of dependencies would make things easier.

candidates.title: AsyncSmtpTransport via tokio v0.2
candidates.body:
It already works and can be tested by modifying email and credentials in `examples/smtp_async_gmail.rs`:

    cargo run --no-default-features --features "builder smtp-transport tokio02 tokio02-native-tls" --example smtp_async_gmail


TODO:

* [x] Avoid cloning domain in `upgrade_tokio02_tls` if possible
* [x] Port changes in `AsyncSmtpConnection` to `SmtpConnection` (separate PR)
* [x] Port changes in `AsyncNetworkStream` to `NetworkStream` (separate PR)
* [x] Create `AsyncSmtpTransport`
* [x] Port changes in `AsyncSmtpTransport` to `SmtpTransport` (separate PR)
* [x] make sure there's nothing left that blocks
* [x] documentation and examples
* [ ] tests
* [x] probably move the refactoring commits to a separate PR?
* [ ] connection pool (that will probably be part of the rewrite that removes r2d2 from the public api)
* [ ] timeouts [inspired from reqwest ?](https://docs.rs/reqwest/0.10.7/reqwest/struct.ClientBuilder.html#method.timeout)
* [x] `AsyncStd1Transport` and `Tokio02Transport` -> `AsyncTransport` or `AsyncTransport<AsyncStd1>` and `AsyncTransport<Tokio02>` or something? (how are we going to support async-std)

Known issues:

* [x] since we are using `tokio-rustls` to make rustls async, and we'll probably use `async-tls` for async-std, both of them have to use the same version of rustls as us. Shouldn't be a big problem, since rustls is good enough today and we probably don't need to upgrade as soon as a new one comes out
* [ ] TlsParameters just checks the `native-tls` and the `rustls-tls` features, while for async we need `tokio02-native-tls` and `tokio02-rustls-tls` to actually be able to use them. Currently I don't see a good way of preventing the user from using TlsParameters without the async wrappers around the TLS backends
* [x] AsyncNetworkStream uses AsyncRead and AsyncWrite from the futures crate, which isn't stable. I guess we could avoid exposing AsyncNetworkStream to the public api?

candidates.title: refactor: TlsParameters to not expose the inner tls library
candidates.body:
...as discussed in #443. There are probably other places where we expose them, but that will be for another PR.

Fixes #428

Also made it compile with both TLS libraries enabled.

candidates.title: Add tokio ^0.2 support
candidates.body: I'll rely on CI to run the tests

candidates.title: Refactor async-std support to prepare for more async runtimes
Remove line-wrap crate and replace it with slice.chunks
candidates.body: This replaces the `line-wrap` crate, which hasn't been updated in 2 years, with our own implementation.

candidates.title: Replace unmaintained bufstream crate with std::io::BufReader
candidates.body: The `bufstream` crate is unmaintained and having a BufWriter didn't make sense anyway, since we are flushing it after each write.

candidates.title: Use native-tls as the default tls backend
candidates.body:
This had already been fixed in #377 but was changed back to rustls by https://github.com/lettre/lettre/commit/b3414bd1ff729684308d4935aae86ee7ee405577, probably by mistake?

This already created some confusion in https://github.com/rust-lang/crates.io/pull/2631 since users expect native-tls to be the default tls backend.

candidates.title: Replace textnonce with rand (reduce dependencies)
candidates.body:
The textnonce dependency pulls in quite a few transitive dependencies.

```
├── textnonce v0.7.1
│   ├── base64 v0.12.3
│   ├── byteorder v1.3.4
│   ├── chrono v0.4.12
│   │   ├── num-integer v0.1.43
│   │   │   └── num-traits v0.2.12
│   │   │       [build-dependencies]
│   │   │       └── autocfg v1.0.0
│   │   │   [build-dependencies]
│   │   │   └── autocfg v1.0.0
│   │   ├── num-traits v0.2.12 (*)
│   │   └── time v0.1.43 (*)
│   ├── rand v0.7.3
│   │   ├── getrandom v0.1.14
│   │   │   ├── cfg-if v0.1.10
│   │   │   └── libc v0.2.71
│   │   ├── libc v0.2.71
│   │   ├── rand_chacha v0.2.2
│   │   │   ├── ppv-lite86 v0.2.8
│   │   │   └── rand_core v0.5.1
│   │   │       └── getrandom v0.1.14 (*)
│   │   └── rand_core v0.5.1 (*)
│   └── serde v1.0.114 (*)
```

However, we only use textnonce in a single location, to generate MIME boundaries. For this, we can use `rand` directly (which is already a transitive dependency anyways, since it's required by uuid).

This reduces the dependency count for a standard build from 117 to 105.

Here are some random boundaries generated:

```
boundary: gAYsFH7KRCgSW3uJkyKIiBJuJ4gUqZokJu8FIpbpo5UCwD7g8aGd8kwkgLsZ7aL5zddh
boundary: VciMYYXqgjNU0Fjo15k3BtedU2x5mQGtSbaLwkkge3BQFXacfRWuJAUwytpPpGkU25NN
boundary: OjfdZWSIE4VIrKKjjrwZE7T0tzVO8DvXCRVhhLfzSz5DN9LGVNVDAss3ODa0bmvFxyUX
boundary: oJZWQuwNlXyE17qRr093o6rTmZteHAsSvgyNqDjDWG9CgOnUGDS3zaAxnv3hRjPvJT1N
boundary: kcAQwffzeyhRt8kqNzmUdqCFCZ83PEUnOC3Eb9sNQIWooG5i0pvouzRJovNbO0AKUcxR
boundary: jdoGYfuuRsgqNgCStV9neilRUMTwbV4qdxMQGh2YXZhUhVwTRS3zZJsxLPUxOTJpKKiC
boundary: LA7cYFPdoTFIQ7o6EqF1GX1cHg0LBe1aX0d2vt4Sjr13rVHQpqociqOX911L7YmUpUNm
boundary: tT30iEnwLmXxiBPnFqiawFDnpZjRxTHz7WTZnyFQhv7UST47ayulZ0yFYKM6rtt4P0u1
boundary: 1dfvMbDqOPjsaqyjXzDVbpZWvckkjxHwC95DfhUVyVoWWeayZcTokJHPTzeYZGJNDvvw
boundary: rmgSfVv8Jw6eeozoUjKA9HUogdlYFFRnbkXQSEqW2oZnkg6ZE3RcAb1KUZJ2p06VCcDj
...
```
